===The PageRank system===
===The PageRank system===
Google's central PageRank system has been criticized, some calling it "undemocratic". Common arguments are that the system is unfairly biased towards large web sites, and that the criteria for a page's importance are not subject to [[peer review]]. The system is also highly susceptible to manipulation and fraud through the use of dummy sites.
Google's central PageRank system has been criticized, some calling it "undemocratic". Common arguments are that the system is unfairly biased towards large web sites, and that the criteria for a page's importance are not subject to [[peer review]]. The system is also highly susceptible to manipulation and fraud through the use of dummy sites.
  +   +
The system uses a series of characteristics to make it as effective as it is. Denoting when words are in bold case, or a larger font, when words are linked to, and what other sites(and how many of them) link to your site. The number of times a term is mentioned are also taken into account. This level of detail makes for far more accurate results, which gave Google a huge lead in terms of usefullness to the end-user when it first debuted. Since then, webmasters have learned to use these features against Google, linking to and repeatedly mentioning terms on a page to unfairly improve ranking in search results. Google has the policy of change early and often, thus, tweaks are made on a monthly basis sometimes, in an attempt to improve results and keep the frauds at bay.
